**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
Reported by @cduchesne 

When you deploy a pod with a non-existent ConfigMap or Secret, and then terminate it before it ever starts up, it will leave an unclean configmap/secret volume path on host fileystem. This will result in "orphaned pod" errors for said pod until kubelet is restarted or configmap/secret directories are cleaned manually.

Example:
```
Jun 05 19:46:58 xxxx kubelet[47894]: E0605 19:46:58.301042   47894 kubelet_volumes.go:140] Orphaned pod "920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8" found, but volume paths are still present on disk : There were a total of 3 errors similar to this. Turn up verbosity to see them.
```

**What you expected to happen**:

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Reproducable: Always

```
1. Create following example pod with configmap cm-data (cm-data should not exist):

apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: cm-test
spec:
  containers:
  - name: cm-test
    image: alpine:3.7
    command: ["sh", "-c", "tail -f /dev/null"]
    volumeMounts:
    - name: cm-data
      mountPath: /data
  volumes:
  - name: cm-data
    configMap:
      name: cm-data


2. Get kubelet location and pod id.

$ kubectl get pods cm-data -o wide && kubectl get pod cm-test -o jsonpath='{.metadata.uid}'; echo
NAME                        READY     STATUS              RESTARTS   AGE       IP              NODE
cm-test                     0/1       ContainerCreating   0          5s        <none>          node01
920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8

3. Tail logs of kubelet on destination host

$ journalctl -xef -u kubelet | grep 920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8
Jun 05 19:42:32 node01kubelet[47894]: E0605 19:42:32.641477   47894 nestedpendingoperations.go:267] Operation for "\"kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data\" (\"920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8\")" failed. No retries permitted until 2018-06-05 19:42:40.64144685 +0000 GMT m=+75968.664028021 (durationBeforeRetry 8s). Error: "MountVolume.SetUp failed for volume \"cm-data\" (UniqueName: \"kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data\") pod \"cm-test\" (UID: \"920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8\") : configmaps \"cm-data\" not found"
Jun 05 19:42:40 node01kubelet[47894]: E0605 19:42:40.663968   47894 nestedpendingoperations.go:267] Operation for "\"kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data\" (\"920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8\")" failed. No retries permitted until 2018-06-05 19:42:56.663932466 +0000 GMT m=+75984.686513624 (durationBeforeRetry 16s). Error: "MountVolume.SetUp failed for volume \"cm-data\" (UniqueName: \"kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data\") pod \"cm-test\" (UID: \"920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8\") : configmaps \"cm-data\" not found"
Jun 05 19:42:56 node01kubelet[47894]: E0605 19:42:56.711153   47894 nestedpendingoperations.go:267] Operation for "\"kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data\" (\"920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8\")" failed. No retries permitted until 2018-06-05 19:43:28.711123827 +0000 GMT m=+76016.733704996 (durationBeforeRetry 32s). Error: "MountVolume.SetUp failed for volume \"cm-data\" (UniqueName: \"kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data\") pod \"cm-test\" (UID: \"920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8\") : configmaps \"cm-data\" not found"

3. Delete pod and watch tail of destination host:

Jun 05 19:43:27 node01kubelet[47894]: I0605 19:43:27.600572   47894 reconciler.go:181] operationExecutor.UnmountVolume started for volume "default-token-9xmgq" (UniqueName: "kubernetes.io/secret/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-default-token-9xmgq") pod "920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8" (UID: "920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8")
Jun 05 19:43:27 node01kubelet[47894]: I0605 19:43:27.600656   47894 reconciler.go:285] Volume detached for volume "cm-data" (UniqueName: "kubernetes.io/configmap/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-cm-data") on node "node09" DevicePath ""
Jun 05 19:43:27 node01kubelet[47894]: I0605 19:43:27.614104   47894 operation_generator.go:686] UnmountVolume.TearDown succeeded for volume "kubernetes.io/secret/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-default-token-9xmgq" (OuterVolumeSpecName: "default-token-9xmgq") pod "920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8" (UID: "920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8"). InnerVolumeSpecName "default-token-9xmgq". PluginName "kubernetes.io/secret", VolumeGidValue ""
Jun 05 19:43:27 node01kubelet[47894]: I0605 19:43:27.700922   47894 reconciler.go:285] Volume detached for volume "default-token-9xmgq" (UniqueName: "kubernetes.io/secret/920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8-default-token-9xmgq") on node "node09" DevicePath ""
Jun 05 19:43:34 node01kubelet[47894]: E0605 19:43:34.292835   47894 kubelet_volumes.go:140] Orphaned pod "920ed6d3-68f8-11e8-a5c9-5cb9018ebed8" found, but volume paths are still present on disk : There were a total of 2 errors similar to this. Turn up verbosity to see them.

```

**Anything else we need to know?**:

Error is same for ConfigMaps and Secrets because they have similar SetUpAt functions.

@cduchesne believes the error is from:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/volume/configmap/configmap.go#L197

And he suggests:
mountpath is created before getting ConfigMap/Secret. If kubelet fails to get ConfigMap, it errors without cleaning up what it started. Easiest fix is to move volume prep to after retrieval of ConfigMap (which should be done anyway), but should also clean up after failure.
